articles.name: Touch Grass FAQ
articles.title: Touch Grass FAQ
articles.body:
From April 1, 2025 (9:00AM PDT) to April 7, 2025 (11:59PM PDT) play the new adventure by Discord and earn an avatar decoration. This avatar decoration will be yours until May 1, 2025 (12:00AM PDT).

What this article covers:
  • How to Play
  • Frequently Asked Questions

How to Play

NOTE: The game is only available to play on the desktop app and browser.

Option 1

1. Tap on the alert in the bottom-right corner and then press on the right arrow icon to access the game.

Example of the alert that will appear in the Discord app

2. Press on Play Game to start the game.

Example of where to locate The Last Meadow under your User Settings

Option 2

1. Open User Settings by pressing the cogwheel [] in the bottom-left corner and select The Last Meadow in the left sidebar. 

2. Tap on Play Game to start the game!

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: What clients is this game available on?

A: The game is only available on desktop app/browser. Unfortunately, the game cannot be played on the mobile version of the app.

Q: How long does the avatar decoration last? 

A: The avatar decoration is yours until May 1, 2025 (12:00AM PDT).

Q: How long will this game be available? 

A: The game will be available until April 7, 2025 (11:59PM PDT). After this time, the game will be removed and cannot be played in the app.

Q: Will my score be saved if I exit the game? 

A: Yes, when you go back to The Last Meadow tab in your User Settings, you can tap on the Continue Game option to continue your progress.

Example of where to tap to continue your game

articles.name: Discord Audio and Video Error Codes: Troubleshooting Guide
articles.title: Discord Audio and Video Error Codes: Troubleshooting Guide
articles.body:
Having trouble with Discord? Here's a comprehensive guide to common audio and video error codes and how to resolve them.

To learn more about troubleshooting audio and video issues on Discord, make sure to check out our Discord Voice and Video Troubleshooting Guide! 

What this article covers:

  • Streaming Issues
  • Audio Issues
  • Debug Logs
  • Quick Reference Error Table
  • Still Need Support?

Streaming Issues

Sound Sharing Issues (1001)

If your stream has no sound, this is likely because Discord couldn't capture audio from your application.

To fix this, try:

  • Allow Discord's soundshare permission when prompted - this is essential for capturing audio from your application during streaming.
    • When you start a stream, Discord will display a system-level permission request that needs to be approved to enable sound sharing functionality. Select “Grant Access”
    • Without this permission, your stream will continue but viewers won't be able to hear any audio from your streaming application

Noise Canceller Error (1002)

If Discord encounters an internal error with its background noise canceller:

  • Leave the voice channel or call and then rejoin to reset the connection
  • If the issue persists, try completely restarting Discord
    • Note: This means fully closing the application (not just minimizing it) and relaunching it!

Audio Input Rate Mismatch (1003)

This error occurs when Discord detects a significant difference in microphone input rate, often resulting in distorted audio (like "robot voice" or slow speech).

To resolve this issue, try:

  • Using separate devices for audio input and output (e.g., USB microphone + separate headphones)
  • Switching to a different microphone if available
  • Changing your audio output device
  • Leaving and rejoining the voice channel
This issue is most common with combined input/output devices like gaming headsets. Using separate devices for input and output typically resolves the problem.

Stream Start Failure (2001)

If your stream fails to start, try:

  • Restarting the stream by clicking the "Go Live" button again.
  • If the issue persists, try closing and reopening Discord before making another attempt to start your stream

Stream Quality Issues (2002-2007)

You might encounter these errors if you're experiencing:

  • Low frame rates while viewing or streaming
  • High packet loss while viewing or streaming
  • Poor network quality while streaming

Common solutions for viewing/streaming issues include:

  • Checking your network connection quality and speed
  • Reducing stream resolution or frame rate settings
  • Ensuring your hardware specifications (CPU, GPU, and RAM) meet the recommended requirements for your chosen stream quality settings and making adjustments accordingly

Video Decoder/Encoder Errors (2008-2009)

These errors typically occur when Discord encounters internal issues processing video streams.

To resolve these issues:

  • Enable hardware acceleration in Discord's Video settings
  • Make sure your graphics drivers are up to date by visiting your graphics card manufacturer's website and downloading the latest stable driver version for your specific graphics card model
  • If issues persist, try restarting Discord completely
    • Note: This means fully closing the application (not just minimizing it) and relaunching it!

Stream at Maximum Viewers (2010)

This error occurs when you try to join a stream that has already reached its maximum viewer capacity.

When you encounter this error:

  • You'll need to wait until other viewers leave the stream before you can join
  • Try joining again later when the viewer count has decreased

Video Streamer Timeout (2011 & 2014)

If your stream or camera fails to establish an initial connection:

  • Check your network connection stability
  • Ensure hardware acceleration is enabled in Discord's settings
  • Verify your system resources aren't overloaded

Video Viewer Timeout (2012 & 2015)

When attempting to view a stream, but you're unable to establish the initial connection:

  • Enable hardware acceleration in Discord's Video settings
  • Check your network connection
  • Try closing and reopening Discord if the issue persists

Camera Frame Rate Issues (2013)

This typically occurs when your device's hardware is struggling to process the video feed.

If your camera video is sending at an unusually low frame rate:

  • Enable hardware acceleration in Discord's Video settings
  • Check if your device meets the hardware requirements for video streaming

Audio Issues

No Audio Input Devices (3001)

If Discord can't detect your microphone, ensure that:

  • You have a microphone physically connected to your device, either through USB, audio jack, or wireless connection.
  • Make sure the microphone is securely plugged in and recognized by your operating system

Try the following steps for a Mic Test as well:

  • Head to the Voice & Video tab (in your User Settings)
  • Use the Mic Test feature to test your microphone by pressing the “Let’s Check” button
  • Listen to the playback of your voice to see if Discord is detecting your microphone

Silent Audio Input (3002)

If your microphone is connected but not picking up sound, try:

  • Checking your operating system's input volume settings in your system sound preferences or control panel to ensure the microphone input level is properly adjusted and not set too low
  • Verifying your microphone or headset isn't muted by checking both the physical mute switch on your device and the software mute settings in your operating system's audio controls
  • Use the Mic Test feature (in the Voice & Video tab of your User Settings) to test your microphone by pressing the “Let’s Check” button and listen to the playback of your voice to see if Discord is detecting your microphone

Screen Share OS Not Supported (3003)

This error occurs when you attempt to use screen sharing on an unsupported Android version.

If you encounter this error:

  • You'll need to upgrade your Android device to version 12 or later to use screen sharing functionality
  • This error is specific to Android devices - other platforms are not affected
To learn more about Discord’s OS/system requirements, visit this Help Center article for more information.

Debug Logs

Debug Log Upload Failure (4001)

If you're unable to upload debug logs, try:

  • Checking your network connection to ensure you have a stable internet connection with sufficient bandwidth
  • Attempting the upload again after waiting a few moments

Quick Reference Error Table

Use this table to quickly identify and resolve common Discord errors:

Error Code What's Happening? How to Fix It
1001 No sound in your stream Click "Allow" when Discord asks for sound sharing permission
1002 Noise canceller error Leave the call/voice channel and rejoin
1003 Audio input rate mismatch ("robot voice") Try switching to separate audio input/output devices
2001 Stream won't start Try starting your stream again
2002 Low frame rate while watching Check connection and enable hardware acceleration
2003 Packet loss while watching Check your network connection or try a different network
2004 Packet loss while streaming Lower your stream quality or check your network connection
2005 Low frame rate while streaming Reduce stream quality or check if your device meets requirements
2006 Poor streaming connection Test your internet speed and ensure stable connection
2007 Stream is reconnecting Check your network connection
2008 Video decoder error Try turning hardware acceleration on in video settings
2009 Video encoder error Try turning hardware acceleration on in video settings
2010 Stream is at maximum viewers Wait for viewers to leave before joining
2011 Video stream timeout (Streamer) Enable hardware acceleration, check network and system load
2012 Video stream timeout (Viewer) Enable hardware acceleration and check network
2013 Camera sending low frame rate Enable hardware acceleration in video settings
2014 Video stream timeout (Streamer) Enable hardware acceleration, check network and system load
2015 Video stream timeout (Viewer) Enable hardware acceleration and check network
3001 No microphone detected Connect a microphone to your device
3002 Microphone not picking up sound Check OS volume and device mute switches
3003 Screen sharing not supported Upgrade to Android 12 or later (Android only)
4001 Debug log upload failed Check connection and try uploading again
 
Most streaming issues (2001-2006) can be resolved by checking your network connection or lowering your stream quality settings.

Still Need Support?

If you continue experiencing issues after trying these solutions, contact Discord Support for additional assistance with all the following information:

  1. A clear description of your issue and the error code you see
  2. The device and OS version you’re using? (ex. ipadOS 13, iOS 13, iOS 16)
  3. The Discord app version you’re using (ex: Version 26.1)
  4. Which clients is this issue occurring on (ex: browser, mobile and/or desktop)?
  5. Screenshots of all your Voice & Video settings
  6. (If applicable) A list of input and output devices you’re using
To contact the Discord support team, send a request through: http://dis.gd/contact

articles.name: Server Profile
articles.title: Server Profile
articles.body:
Looking for how to customize your per-server profile? Please check out this Help Center article.

Your Discord Server Profile is the first impression of your server. Customizing it helps showcase what your server is all about—whether its gaming, learning, or socializing. A well-crafted profile attracts the right community members or can show what your friend group is all about. Let’s explore how to make yours stand out!

What this article covers:
  • What are Server Profiles?
  • How to Customize a Server Profile
    • Name
    • Icon
    • Banner
    • Traits
    • Description
    • Games
    • Private Profile

What are Server Profiles?

Server Profiles are customizable information cards that showcase the identity and community of both personal and community Discord servers. Whether it's a friend's private server or a larger community space, these profiles display key details like the server's name, description, icon, games, and unique traits. They help potential members understand what your server is about before joining and appear when users explore or discover servers across Discord.

Server admins and owners can customize their server's profile to highlight unique interests, set expectations for new members, and make their community more discoverable to like-minded individuals.

How to Customize a Server Profile

A Server Profile can only be customized on desktop/browser, however, can be viewed on the mobile app.

To customize your server profile, navigate to your Server Settings by selecting the dropdown arrow [] next to your server's name. You'll be taken directly to the Server Profile tab.

Navigating to your Server Profile

Here are the customization options available:

  • Name - Choose a clear, memorable identity for your server
  • Icon - Upload a distinctive symbol that represents your community
  • Banner - Pick a banner to add color to your server profile
  • Traits - Select tags that describe your server's focus and  promote discovery
  • Description - Write an engaging overview of your community
  • Games - List the games your community plays or discusses
  • Private Profile - Control who can view your server's details

Name

Your server's name is its identity- it's the first thing people see when they discover your community. Make it clear, memorable, and representative of what your server is about.

To update your server's name, look for the Name field at the top of the Server Profile page.

When you're finished, press Save Changes to confirm your updates.

Adding a Name to your Server Profile

Save Changes Button

Icon

Your server's icon is a visual representation of your community that appears in Discord's server list and search results. A custom icon helps your server stand out and makes it instantly recognizable.

To update your server's icon, press the Change Server Icon button or select the current icon in the Server Profile tab.

Press Save Changes to apply your updates.

Adding an Icon to your Server Profile

Save Changes Button

Banner

If your server is a discoverable server and you set a custom banner, that banner will be displayed instead.

A server banner is a large header color that appears at the top of your server profile. 

To update your server's banner in the Server Profile tab, select a color tile in the Banner section. 

Select Save Changes when you're done.

NOTE: The first banner color option in this menu that appears is based on your current Server Icon’s color. 

Adding a Banner to your Server Profile

Save Changes Button

Traits

Traits are descriptive tags that help categorize and identify your server's focus areas. These tags make it easier for potential members to find communities that match their interests.

To add or edit traits in the Server Profile tab, select a trait box and type your desired trait. You can also include an emoji by pressing the emoji icon [] in the trait box.

Remember to select Save Changes to apply your updates.

Adding Traits to your Server Profile

Save Changes Button

Description

Your server's description is a detailed explanation of your server’s personality and purpose. 

To add or edit your server's description in the Server Profile tab, locate the Description field and begin typing in the text box below. 

Press Save Changes to apply your updates.

Adding a Description to your Server Profile

Save Changes Button

Games

If your server is focused on gaming, you can specify which games your server plays or discusses. To add or edit games in the Server Profile tab, locate the Games section. You can either select games from the available options or search for specific games by typing in the game field.

You can also remove a game from the list by pressing the checkmark [] n the upper-right corner of the game.

Selecting Games to Add to your Server Profile

Checkmark Icon in the Upper-right Corner of a Game

Private Profile

The Private Profile option allows you to control the visibility of your server's profile. When enabled, your server's profile information will only be visible to members who have already joined the server.

This option is enabled by default, however, your profile content becomes viewable to users outside your server when you:
  • Enable server discovery
  • Enable server widget
  • Create an announcement channel
You can re-enable Private Profile through your Server Settings, except for servers currently in Discover. If you disable any of these features mentioned above, you will still have to manually enable Private Profile.

In the Server Profile tab, find and toggle the Private Profile switch to control visibility.

Toggling Private Profile

articles.name: DM Wallpapers
articles.title: DM Wallpapers
articles.body:
DM Wallpapers are a feature that lets users personalize their direct message (DM) or group chat by applying background images in Discord. Whether you're looking to customize your chat experience or troubleshoot wallpaper settings, you'll find everything you need to know here.

What this article covers:
  • What are DM Wallpapers?
  • How to Set a DM Wallpaper
    • Option 1
    • Option 2
  • How to Hide a DM Wallpaper
    • For DM and Group Chat Members
    • For the DM Wallpaper Setter
  • Frequently Asked Questions

What are DM Wallpapers?

Choosing and setting DM wallpapers is currently an experiment available to select Nitro users only. This feature is not available to users with a Nitro Basic membership.

DM wallpapers allow Nitro users to choose and set a background image from our selection of 15+ images in their direct messages or group chats. All members in a DM can see the wallpaper, regardless of whether they have Nitro, but only Nitro members can select wallpaper options.

How to Set a DM Wallpaper

DM wallpapers are a desktop-only feature that requires dark mode for both viewing and customizing. Learn more about themes here. Users will have one of the two options listed below to access this feature.

Option 1

1. To set a DM wallpaper, right-click a DM or group chat and select Set DM Wallpaper. 

Set DM wallpaper option

2. This opens the Preview a DM Wallpaper window with all available wallpaper options. Choose your preferred wallpaper from the selection.

Preview a DM wallpaper window

3. Press Apply to save your choice.

Setting a DM wallpaper using the preview window

To add a blur effect to your DM wallpaper, select Blur in the bottom-left corner of the preview window.

Blur option in the preview window

Option 2

1. To set a DM wallpaper, navigate to the DM or group chat and select the Set DM Wallpaper icon [] in the upper-right corner. This opens the Preview a DM Wallpaper window with all available wallpaper options.

Set DM Wallpaper icon

2. Choose your preferred wallpaper from the selection.

3. Press Apply to save your choice.

Preview a DM wallpaper window

How to Hide a DM Wallpaper

If you're not the wallpaper setter, hiding a wallpaper will only hide it for you—other users in the DM or group chat will still see it.

For DM or Group Chat Members

If you're a DM or group chat member and want to hide a wallpaper that someone else set, select Hide Wallpaper in the system message.

Hide Wallpaper button in system message

After hiding the wallpaper, you can reveal it again by pressing Reapply.

Reapplying a DM wallpaper

For the DM Wallpaper Setter

To remove a wallpaper you’ve set, open the Preview a DM wallpaper window and select the Remove wallpaper option. Press Apply to save your changes. 

When you remove the wallpaper, it will be removed for all users in the DM or group chat.

Removing a DM Wallpaper Using the Preview Window

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Is it available on both desktop and mobile?

A: No, this feature is only available on desktop for both viewing and making changes.

Q: When I change the wallpaper, can other chat members see it?

A: Yes, wallpaper changes apply to all members in the direct message. However, members can opt out by selecting Hide Wallpaper in the wallpaper system update message that appears in the chat.

Q: How can I hide a DM wallpaper?

A: Whenever the wallpaper changes, you'll receive a system notification in the direct message. The only method to hide a DM wallpaper is to press the Hide Wallpaper button on the right side of the system message to hide the wallpaper.

Q: Can I prevent others from changing my wallpaper?

A: When someone changes a wallpaper, it affects everyone in the DM or group chat. If you didn’t set the wallpaper and don't want to see the current one, you can hide it by following the steps here. 

The wallpaper will remain hidden for you, until a new wallpaper is set. If you’ve hidden the wallpaper and want to see it again, select Reapply.

articles.name: Nameplates FAQ
articles.title: Nameplates FAQ
articles.body:
Make your name stand out with Nameplates! These special designs customize how your name appears in your direct messages (DMs), group chats and servers, giving your name that extra fun and flair wherever you go on Discord.

What this article covers:
  • What are Nameplates?
  • How can I purchase a Nameplate?
    • Desktop/Browser
  • How do I apply a Nameplate?
    • Desktop/Browser
  • Where do Nameplates appear?
  • Frequently Asked Questions

What are nameplates?

Nameplates are unique designs that let you customize how your display name appears on Discord. While Avatar Decorations and Profile Effects let you personalize your profile, Nameplates let you add more flair to your name so it stands out with style in your DMs, group chats, and servers.

Example of a Nameplate

How can I purchase a Nameplate?

Nameplates are only available on desktop for purchase, but you can still view others’ Nameplates on mobile.

Desktop/Browser

Option 1

You can head over to the Shop to preview and purchase Nameplates.
1. Navigate to your Direct Messages list by selecting the Discord app icon in the upper-left corner.

Direct Messages Icon

2. Then, press the Shop tab [] to the right of the server list to enter the Shop! 

Shop tab

3. Once directed to the Shop, you can preview and buy Nameplates which get  added to your collection. 

Example of Nameplates in the Shop

Option 2

1. To access your User Settings, select the cogwheel icon [] in the lower-left corner of the app, then navigate to the Profiles section. 

Cogwheel Icon

2. Once there, you will see the banner to the Shop where you can select Check it out. You can also select Change Nameplate and select the Shop icon [].  

Access Shop via User Settings

3. Once directed to the Shop, you can preview and buy Nameplates to add to your collection.

Purchased Nameplates get added to your collection, which can be found in User Settings > Profiles > Nameplate. Items available for purchase in the Shop will change periodically.

How do I apply a Nameplate?

Desktop/Browser

1. On the desktop app or web app, head into your User Settings by selecting the cogwheel []. 

Cogwheel Icon

2. Once directed to your User Settings, select the Profiles tab to view your profile settings. 

3. Then, press the Change Nameplate button to open the Nameplate selection menu. 

Change Nameplate Button

4. Once you have chosen the Nameplate you would like, select Apply.

Selecting a Nameplate

5. After you apply your selected Nameplate, confirm your changes by selecting Save Changes. 

Save Changes Button

Where do Nameplates appear?

After applying a Nameplate, it will be visible across several key areas of Discord:

  • User Settings bar

Example of Nameplate in User Settings Bar

  • Your DMs and Group Chats
When hovering or selected, the Nameplate will appear for the DM/Group Chat name.

Example of Nameplate in DMs

  • Members Lists within Servers, Channels, and Threads

Example of Nameplate in Members List 

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Can everyone see my Nameplate or just me?
A: Everyone can see your Nameplate.

Q: Do Nitro subscribers get discounts on Nameplates?
A: Yes, Nitro subscribers receive discounts on all items in the Shop, including Nameplates.
Q: Are Nameplates available to purchase and edit on mobile?
A: Currently, you can only purchase and edit Nameplates on desktop. However, Nameplates are visible on both desktop and mobile devices.
Q: Can I get a refund for my Nameplate purchase?
A: While Nameplates are generally non-refundable, as stated in our Refund Policy, if you purchased one during our experimental phase (before April 21, 2025), you can submit a refund request to Discord support here by May 5th, 2025. Otherwise, all Nameplate purchases are final.

Q: Can I refund Nitro after buying a Nameplate?
A: No, if you’ve purchased a Nameplate within 5 days of starting or renewing your Nitro subscription, you will not be eligible to refund that Nitro subscription.
Q: Can Nameplates be turned off? I don't want to see them.
A: Nameplates cannot be turned off, but you can go to User Settings > Accessibility > Enable Reduced Motion to minimize Nameplate animations and effects.
Q: I purchased a nameplate but I don’t see it on my name?
A: Currently, Nameplates show when you are active on Discord so ensure you are not in invisible mode or offline.

articles.name: How to Verify Age Group
articles.title: How to Verify Age Group
articles.body:
We provide age verification to help users manage content filter settings and sensitive content visibility. This one-time process can be completed when you first adjust these settings, with the option to re-verify if needed.

The age verification features described are an experiment and available only to users in the United Kingdom and Australia.

What this article covers:

  • Why do I need to verify my age group?
  • When do I need to verify my age?
  • How do I verify my age group?
  • Frequently Asked Questions

Why do I need to verify my age group?

Some Discord settings and content are designed for certain age groups. We're experimenting with a streamlined way for you to verify your age group when you try to access those settings or content.

NOTE: Age verification is required to unblur media flagged by our sensitive media filter and to update your sensitive media filter settings.

When do I need to verify my age?

You may be asked to verify your age in two situations:

1. When you encounter content flagged by our sensitive media filter, you may need to verify your age group.

Example of Blurred Sensitive Media in a Message

2. When you try to change your sensitive content filter settings and need to verify your age first. 

Sensitive Content Settings in Content & Social

How do I verify my age group?

The age verification process works the same way, regardless of how it is triggered. Here’s how to verify to verify your age group:

1. When you encounter blurred sensitive content or try to change content filter settings, you'll be prompted to verify your age if you haven't done so already. This requirement applies to users who haven't verified their age and are included in this experiment.

Example of Verify age group window

2. A We need to verify your age window will appear, offering two verification options: 

  • Option 1: Face Scan 
    • Select Face Scan on the verification page. 
    • Allow access to your camera when prompted.
    • Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the scan. 
    • Press Done to submit.
  • Option 2: Scan ID 
    • Select Scan ID on the verification page. 
    • Use your mobile device to scan the QR code.
    • Take a clear photo of your ID following the guidelines.
    • Press Done to submit.

Face Scan and Scan ID options in the Age Verification window

After verification, you'll receive system messages about the verification process and a Direct Message from Discord's official profile confirming your verified age group.

Example of direct message (DM) notification from Discord confirming your age verification status

If the verification fails, you can either try again or contact our Trust & Safety team to request a manual review.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Is my data stored when I use Face Scan or ID verification?

A: The information you share to power the age verification method that you choose is only used for the one-time age verification process and is not stored by Discord or its vendor. For Face Scan, the solution our vendor uses operates on-device, which means there is no collection of any biometric information when you scan your face. For ID verification, the scan of your ID is deleted upon verification.

Q: Do I need to verify my age to access content flagged by our Sensitive Media Filter and settings?

A: Yes, age verification is required before you can access that flagged content and the sensitive media filter settings.

Q: Do I need to verify my age multiple times to change the settings for the Sensitive Media Filter?

A: No. Age verification is a one-time process. Once your age group is confirmed, you won't need to verify again when you attempt to access an age-restricted feature. However, if you believe your age group is incorrect, you may retry the age verification process again.

Q: What happens if my age group is verified incorrectly or it fails to verify.

A: You have two options:

  1. Retry verification through your chat with Discord system messages where you can select Retry to enter the verification flow again.
  2. You can retry by opting for a manual review here. 

Q: How long does verification take?

A: The verification process typically takes just a few minutes. You'll receive notifications about the status and a DM from Discord's official profile once completed.

Example of DM notification from Discord confirming your age verification status

Q: What happens if I’m banned after age verification?

A: Your account may be banned if your age is below the minimum requirement. If you believe the result is incorrect, you can submit an appeal through the underage appeals process here.

articles.name: How to Use Voice Filters on Discord
articles.title: How to Use Voice Filters on Discord
articles.body:
Voice filters are designed to change how you sound in voice and video calls. They add a creative and engaging touch to conversations through the desktop app and make interactions more fun and expressive.

What this article covers:
  • What are voice filters?
  • How to Use Voice Filters
    • How to Enable Playback
    • Previewing a Voice Filter
    • Removing a Voice Filter
  • Frequently Asked Questions
[Beta] Voice filters is currently an experiment and available to a limited group of users on Windows desktop only.

What are voice filters?

You can choose from a variety of voice filters to change how you sound on voice and video calls. Voice filters provide additional options for modifying your voice and allow you to sound how you want no matter what you’re up to–epic story telling for roleplay, hyping up your team or just hanging with friends. 

Some voice filters are always free to use at any time, while some are locked. You can get access to the full collection for even more ways to customize your voice with a Nitro subscription.

NOTE: While this feature is in experimentation, your mic quality will affect how clear voice filters sound. If you're finding your filtered voice is difficult to understand, try switching to a different microphone to improve the sound quality.

How to Use Voice Filters

1. To navigate to your Microphone Settings, tap the drop-down arrow [] located to the bottom-left of the app, next to the mic icon [].

Microphone Settings drop-down arrow icon 

2. Select any of the available options to apply the voice filter to your input audio.

Example of available voice filter options in Discord

3. When a voice filter has been applied, a banner will appear letting you know which one is currently active.

Example of what it looks like when you have a voice filter enabled.

How to Enable Playback 

With playback enabled, you'll hear your voice with the filter applied played back with a slight delay as you speak. This way, you can hear yourself as others do. Playback is on by default, but you can always easily disable and enable it. 

NOTE:Using headsets is highly recommended when playback is enabled, to avoid a feedback loop.

1. Navigate to your Microphone Settings by tapping the drop-down arrow [] located to the bottom-left of the app, located next to the mic icon [].

Microphone Settings drop-down arrow icon 

2. After applying a voice filter, you can tap on the ear icon [] to enable audio playback. To disable, tap the same icon.

Example of playback icon

Previewing a Voice Filter

Before you decide what voice filter is right for you, you can preview each one that is available and listen to the example audio. 

1. Navigate to your Microphone Settings by tapping drop-down arrow [] located to the bottom-left of the app, located next to the mic icon [].

Microphone Settings drop-down arrow icon

2. Hover over each available voice filter and then press on the play icon [] to preview each voice filter.

Preview Voice icon

Removing a Voice Filter

1. Tap the drop-down arrow located to the bottom-left of the app to navigate to Microphone Settings.

Microphone Settings drop-down arrow icon 

2. Tap the X located on the right-hand side of the active voice filter banner to disable the voice filter.

X button to remove the applied voice filter

NOTE: Have feedback about voice filters? We'd love to hear from you! Share your thoughts in our feedback forum to help us improve this experimental feature.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: How come I don’t see voice filters? Can I request voice filters?

A: No, voice filters are currently in experimentation and only available to a limited group of users.

Q: Do voice filters stay on for all calls or do I need to set it up for each call?

A: A voice filter stays enabled unless you remove it. To remove a voice filter, simply tap the drop-down arrow [] located to the right of the mic icon [] and tap on the X located in the right-hand side of the active voice filter banner.

X button to remove the applied voice filter

Q: How can I tell if I have a voice filter active?

A: You can tell a voice filter is currently active by checking your mic indicator in the bottom-left corner of the Discord app. If a voice filter is active your microphone icon will have a star on it.

Example of microphone icon when a voice filter enabled

Q: Why do I not have access to all the voice filters? How do the daily free filters work?

A: Voice filters that aren’t grayed out are always available. Filters with a clock icon [] are part of the rotating free selection. When the timer reaches zero, a new set of free filters will be available for a limited time. Filters that are grayed out can be unlocked with Nitro.

Example of a voice filter with the clock icon

Q: Does Discord store my voice data?
A: Discord does not store any voice data or use voice data for any identifying purposes. Voice filters are synthesized on your device.

articles.name: Nitro Quest Perk
articles.title: Nitro Quest Perk
articles.body:
Discord Nitro subscribers will gain extended access to Quest avatar decoration rewards - allowing them to use the new rewards for longer and restore previously expired decorations. This premium feature enhances your customization options across all Discord platforms.

What this article covers:
  • Understanding the Nitro Quest Perk
  • Finding Your Quest Avatar Decorations
    • Desktop
    • Mobile
  • Frequently Asked Questions

Understanding the Nitro Quest Perk

Normally, avatar decorations earned through Quests are available for two months. However, Nitro subscribers get an exclusive perk: the ability to keep many of these decorations for an extended period. We're working to make even more Quest rewards eligible for this benefit.

Requirements to utilize the Nitro Quest Perk:

  • This benefit is exclusively for Nitro subscribers on the standard plan (not available for Nitro Basic or Classic).
  • You must have claimed the decoration reward after completing a Quest to be eligible for extended access.
NOTE:
  • Not all avatar decorations will be eligible for this perk. Eligible rewards will be indicated during the Quest completion experience.
  • If the earned avatar decoration has an expiration date, it will be listed under the specific avatar decoration in Profile Settings > Change Decoration.

Finding Your Quest Avatar Decorations

Once you've earned a Quest decoration, you can easily access and equip it through your User Settings.

NOTE: For more information about avatar decorations in general, check out our Avatar Decorations article.

Desktop

1. To access your Quest-earned avatar decorations on desktop, head into your User Settings by selecting the cogwheel []. 

The User Settings Icon (Cogwheel) in Discord's Desktop App

2. Once redirected to your User Settings, select the Profiles tab to view your profile settings. 

Accessing Your Profile Through the Profile Tab

3. Then, press the Change Decorations button to open the avatar decoration selection menu.  

4. Under the Your Decorations section, you will find your Quest-earned avatar decorations. 

5. Select Apply once you have chosen the Quest-earned avatar decoration to preview your current avatar decoration. 

Example of a Quest avatar decoration under Your Decoration section

6. After you apply an avatar decoration, you will need to confirm your changes by selecting Save Changes. 

Select "Save Changes" to Apply Your Avatar Decoration

Mobile

1. On your mobile device, head into your User Settings by tapping your avatar. 

The User Settings Icon (Cogwheel) in Discord's Mobile App

2. From here, select Edit Profile. 

This will navigate you to the Profile page where you can tap Avatar Decoration to navigate to the Change Decoration page. You can also tap on your avatar and select the Change Decoration option instead.  

Accessing Your Profile by Pressing “Edit Profile”

3. In the Change Decoration menu, under the Your Decorations section, you’ll find your Quest-earned avatar decorations. Select the desired avatar decoration you’d like to apply. 

4. Once you’ve found an avatar decoration you want to use, tap Apply then Save in the upper-right corner to confirm your changes. 

  

Example of Setting an Avatar Decoration   

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Will I lose access to my decorations if my Nitro subscription expires or I downgrade to Nitro Basic?

A: Yes, you will lose access to these decorations. Extended access to Quest-earned avatar decorations requires an active Nitro subscription. If your subscription expires or you downgrade your subscription to Nitro Basic, you'll lose access to the decorations until you re-subscribe.

Q: Can I regain access to decorations from Quests I completed in the past?

A: Not all past avatar decoration rewards are available - however, Nitro members can access some of the decorations they previously earned by completing Quests and claiming the rewards. You can see which decorations are available at Profile Settings > Change Decoration.

Q: Do I need to complete the Quest again to get the decoration back?
A: No. If you previously completed the Quest and claimed the reward, you'll automatically regain access to eligible decorations when you subscribe to Nitro.

Q: Is this Nitro perk applicable to all decoration rewards from Quests?
A: No, not all decorations rewards from Quest are eligible for this Nitro Perk. If decoration reward is not eligible, you will see an expiry date listed under the specific decoration in Profile Settings > Change Decoration.

Q: How do I know how long I can keep a Quest-earned avatar decoration?
A: If the Quest-earned avatar decoration has an expiration date, it will be listed under the specific avatar decoration in Profile Settings > Change Decoration.

articles.name: Server Member Applications
articles.title: Server Member Applications
articles.body:
Learn how to manage Discord server members through applications, invite-only settings, and server discovery. Here we'll show you everything server owners need to know about controlling member access, reviewing applications, and customizing join requirements.

What this article covers:
  • Understanding Server Member Applications
  • How to Configure Server Join Settings
    • Invite Only
    • Apply to Join
    • Discoverable
  • Reviewing Server Member Applications
    • Processing Server Member Applications
  • Frequently Asked Questions

Understanding Server Member Applications

The server member applications feature is rolling out gradually and can only be enabled through the desktop app. However, users applying for a server can submit or withdraw their applications using either desktop or mobile devices.

People can join your server in three ways:

  • Invite only
  • Through Discovery
  • Member application

Using member applications, server owners can precisely control who joins their server. Simply navigate to your Access settings, by pressing the server name in the upper-left corner. Then select Server Settings > Access.

Accessing Server Member Applications

How to Configure Server Join Settings

In Access settings, you can control your server's privacy level by choosing how people join. Select either Invite Only, Apply to Join, or Discoverable under the How can people join your server? section.

Server Join Setting Options: Invite Only, Apply to Join, and Discoverable

Invite Only

Invite Only is the default privacy setting for all Discord servers. This gives you maximum control over who joins your server:

  • Members can only join through valid invite links
  • Enable server rules to require new members to accept your server guidelines before participating
  • Generate customized invite links with expiration dates and usage limits

Invite Only Option

Apply to Join

While applications are pending, users cannot view any server content.

With the Apply to Join option, you can screen potential members by requiring them to complete an application form before joining your server. Here's what you need to know:

  • All applications must be reviewed and approved by server administrators before members can join
  • Create custom questions to ensure new members are a good fit for your community
  • Choose whether to display application links on per-server profile for easier discovery

Apply to Join Option

NOTE: Server members who have the Kick Members permission enabled can create special invite links that bypass the application process. These invite links can be viewed in Server Settings > Invites.

Discoverable

The Discoverable option lets you enable Server Discovery, making your server visible to all Discord users who are searching for new communities:

  • Your server must be set up as a Community server to be discoverable
  • You'll need to meet Discord's discovery eligibility requirements including safety standards
  • Anyone can join and find your server directly through Server Discovery

Discoverable Option

Reviewing Server Member Applications

If your server’s privacy level was set to Apply to Join, server administrators with the appropriate permissions can manage member applications through the Members page. You can learn more about the Members page here.

If a user has applied to join your server, you will notice a notification located next to the Members tab located above the server’s channel list. In the Members page, select the user’s server member application.

You will be able to review the following information:

  • Why they would like to join your server
  • When they joined Discord
  • When they submitted their server member application

Reviewing a Server Members Application in Members Page

Processing Server Member Applications

When reviewing server member applications, you have three processing options:

  • Approve: This grants the user access to your server.
  • Reject: This denies the user access to your server. To permanently prevent a user from reapplying, you can ban them from the server.
  • Interview: You can choose to directly message and interview the user before making your final decision to approve or reject their application.

Example of Selecting Interview

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: How long does it take to review server member applications?

A: The review time varies depending on your server administrators' availability. There is no set timeframe.

Q: Can users edit their server member applications after submitting?

A: No, users cannot edit their applications after submission. However, they can withdraw their application and submit a new one if needed.

Q: Who can review server member applications?

A: Server administrators and members with appropriate permissions (specifically those with the Kick Members permission) can review and process member applications.

Q: What happens if a server member application is rejected?

A: When an application is rejected, the user will be notified and will not gain access to the server. They can choose to apply again unless they have been banned by server administrators.

Q: Can I customize the server member application questions?

A: Yes, server administrators can create custom questions to better screen potential members and ensure they're a good fit for the community.

Q: Do server member applications work on mobile devices?

A: While the feature can only be enabled through the desktop app, users can submit and withdraw applications using either desktop or mobile devices.

articles.name: 3 Months YouTube Premium for Discord Nitro Users Promo FAQ
articles.title: 3 Months YouTube Premium for Discord Nitro Users Promo FAQ
articles.body:
Starting from January 21, 2025 (10:00AM PT) to April 15, 2025 (11:59PM PT), Discord Nitro members can claim 3 months of YouTube Premium. Read more below about the promotion below.

Promotion Summary

Offer Details: 3 months of YouTube Premium for Discord Nitro member

Who is Eligible: To claim through Discord, you must be a current Nitro member (unable to be redeemed if you have a Nitro trial membership

Requirements:

Users located in the United States, Canada, France, Germany, United Kingdom, Japan, and Korea can claim through Discord Gift Inventory from January 21, 2025 (10:00AM PT) to April 15, 2025 (11:59PM PT), and redeem in your YouTube account by May 15, 2025 (11:59PM PT).

Subscription:

After the 3 month free trial period, your YouTube Premium subscription will convert to a monthly or yearly recurring subscription, and YouTube will bill your payment method unless you cancel the subscription.

What this article covers:
  • What is Discord Nitro?
  • What is YouTube Premium? 
  • How do I claim the YouTube Premium in Discord? 
    • Eligibility for Claiming this Promotion in Discord
    • Step By Step Claim Instructions 
  • How do I redeem the YouTube Premium on my YouTube Account? 
    • Eligibility for Redeeming the YouTube Premium
  • How do I share my Code with a Friend?
  • Frequently Asked Questions
    • Promotion Details
    • Eligibility for the Promotion
    • Claiming and Redemption Process
    • Potential Errors and Other Issues

What is Discord Nitro?

Discord Nitro is our membership plan that gives you access to special perks that’ll make your time on Discord as fun as ever! Personalize and enhance your experience with popular perks like HD streaming, 500MB file uploads, profile and avatar customizations, 2 free Server Boosts, and more:

  • Custom Emojis
  • Discord App Color Themes
  • Super Reactions
  • Avatar Decorations
  • Unique Server Profiles
  • Server Boosts
  • More Nitro & Nitro Basic perks

What is YouTube Premium?

YouTube Premium. All YouTube. No interruptions. Now you can watch videos ad-free, keep them playing in the background, and download them to watch anytime, anywhere. You even get uninterrupted access to the YouTube Music app where you can listen to over 100 million official songs ad-free, offline, and in the background. With YouTube Premium, there’s nothing stopping you from playing your favorites. Learn more here.

How do I claim the YouTube Premium in Discord?

As long as you're a Discord Nitro member, you'll be able to claim the YouTube Premium code in the Gift Inventory from January 21, 2025 (10:00AM PT) to April 15, 2025 (11:59PM PT).

Eligibility for the Claiming this Promotion in Discord

In order to claim this code, you'll need to be an active member to Discord Nitro, (and you can be either a monthly or yearly Nitro member).

  • If you are an active Discord Nitro member, the code must be claimed in the Gift Inventory by April 15, 2025 (11:59PM PT).
    • Otherwise, the code will not be available to claim after April 15, 2025 (11:59PM PT).  

Unfortunately, if you are a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting member, you'll need to become a Nitro member in order to claim this promotion.

Step By Step Claim Instructions 

1) Log into Your Discord account and head to the Gift Inventory tab. 

If you’re a Discord Nitro member, start by logging into your Discord account. 

You may notice a notification bar at the top of your browser/desktop app, and you can press the "Take me there" button in the notification bar to be redirected to your Gift Inventory. 

For both the desktop/browser app and mobile app, you can also directly head to your User Settings, and then select Gift Inventory.

2) Click on the Claim button for the YouTube Premium Gift

Once you press Claim on the YouTube Premium Gift in the Gift Inventory and you'll then see a new pop-up with your 12 character code for this promotion.

If you want to redeem your code later, you can press the Maybe Later button, and then redeem the code before May 15, 2025 (11:59PM PT).

How do I redeem the YouTube Premium Trial on my YouTube Account?

Once you have claimed the code in the Gift Inventory, you'll now need to officially redeem this code on your YouTube account (or share this code with a friend).

Eligibility for Redeeming the YouTube Premium Trial

To redeem the 3 months YouTube Premium trial code, this offer is only for eligible potential YouTube Premium subscribers. Learn more here.

Note: If you're running into any issues when attempting to redeem this promotion, and you believe that your YouTube account meets the promotion requirements, reach out to the YouTube support team to review your YouTube account further through here.

How do I share my Code with a Friend?

If you're unable to claim this code on your own YouTube account, you'll be able to share this code with a friend to use instead.

To share the code, you can copy the 12-character code from the Gift Inventory (in your User Settings in the Discord app) and then share this code to a friend in a Direct Message.

Frequently Asked Questions

We know there's a lot of information to unpack on this promotion above, so we've also broken down this information in this FAQ section as well too.

  • Promotion Details
  • Eligibility for the Promotion
  • Claiming and Redemption Process
  • Potential Errors and Other Issues

Promotion Details

Q: How long does this promotion for Nitro members run for?

A: This promotion runs from January 21, 2025 (10:00AM PT) to April 15, 2025 (11:59PM PT).

After April 15, 2025 (11:59PM PT), Nitro members will no longer be able to claim a trial code.

Q: How long does my YouTube Premium code last for in my Gift Inventory?

A: Once a code is claimed in the Gift Inventory in Discord, all YouTube Premium codes must be redeemed by May 15, 2025 (11:59PM PT).

If a code has not been redeemed to the YouTube account by May 15, 2025 (11:59PM PT), it will expire and you will no longer be able to claim 3 months of YouTube Premium.

Eligibility for the Promotion

Q: Who can claim this promotion in the Discord Gift Inventory?

A: All current and new Nitro members are eligible for this perk. 

This does not include Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boost-only members.

Q: Who can redeem this YouTube Premium trial to their YouTube account?

A: Users located in the United States, Canada, France, Germany, United Kingdom, Japan, and Korea can redeem the promo that has not had YouTube premium before. Extended trials are available to first-time members OR 3 years after canceling your previous membership. Learn more here.

Only 1 extended trial is allowed per 3 year period.

Q: Can I redeem the YouTube Premium promotion to my YouTube account in my region? 

A: In order to check whether or not you meet the eligibility requirements to redeem this YouTube promotion, please make sure to review this link for the full details here.

Claiming and Redemption Process

Q: On which Discord platforms can I claim this promotion?

A: You'll be able to claim the promo on the mobile, browser, and desktop version of the Discord app.


Q: Why do I need to submit my payment info to redeem the YouTube Premium trial?

A: Because YouTube Premium is a subscription plan, at the end of your free 3 month trial, your first billing cycle starts so you can continue to enjoy YouTube Premium.

However, you can cancel the YouTube Premium subscription at any time before the end of the 3 months.

If you need further support with your account, you can reach out to YouTube's support team here.

Potential Errors and Other Issues

Q: What if I don't see the YouTube Premium code in my Discord Gift Inventory? 

A: In order to claim this code, you'll need to be an active member to Discord Nitro (not on a Nitro trial) and you can be either a monthly or yearly Nitro member.

Unfortunately, if you are a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting member, you'll need to become a Nitro member in order to claim this promotion.

If you are an active Discord Nitro member, make sure to refresh your Discord client to double check if an update was needed.

  • What if I'm still running into issues? 
    • If the refresh does not work, please submit a ticket through our support system at: https://dis.gd/contact and our support team will be able to investigate further.
    • Be sure to submit the ticket using the email address associated with your Discord account, and send us a screenshot of the following: 
      1. Your My Account tab
      2. Your Gift Inventory tab

Q: I'm having trouble redeeming this promotion to my YouTube account. How do I contact YouTube support? 

A: If you are having issues redeeming this promotion on your YouTube account, you can reach out to YouTube support here.

articles.name: How to Maintain your Nitro and Server Boost Subscription Streaks
articles.title: How to Maintain your Nitro and Server Boost Subscription Streaks
articles.body:
What this article covers:
  • What is a Subscription Streak?
  • How to Maintain Your Nitro Badge Subscription Streak
  • How to Maintain Your Server Boost Subscription Streak
  • How do I Transfer my Server Boost to Maintain my streak?
  • Frequently Asked Questions

What is a Subscription Streak?

Nitro and Server Boosting Badge streaks

A subscription streak is how long you’ve been subscribed to Nitro or Server Boosting a server. The longer you’ve consistently been subscribed, the bigger your streak will be. Your streak can be reset if you are no longer subscribed to Nitro or if you’re not actively boosting a server with a Server Boost.

How to Maintain Your Nitro Badge Subscription Streak

Example of Nitro Badge and subscription streak

Any user that has a Nitro, Nitro Basic, or Nitro Classic subscription will have a Nitro badge on their profile. In order to maintain your Nitro badge streak, you must remain subscribed to Nitro, Nitro Basic, or Nitro Classic. 

If your subscription has ended, you have 7 days to renew your subscription in order to maintain your streak.

You can view your boosting streak by tapping on your avatar icon to reveal your profile and hovering over your Nitro badge.

GIF showing how to view your Nitro badge streak

Note: If your subscription streak has been lost, our Support Team can not adjust your streak.

How to Maintain Your Server Boost Subscription Streak

Note: If you have been removed or left a server that you were boosting, you will have a 7 day cooldown before you can use your boost again. Learn more about transferring a boost below.

If you are also switching your purchase from desktop to mobile or vice versa, you have 72 hours to manually reactivate your Server Boosts in order to not lose your streak.

Server Boosting Badge Streak through User Profile

Your Server Boosting Badge and streak is based on the length of time that you started boosting a server. 

Note: Regardless of how many servers you boost, the length of your streak is dependent on the oldest applied server boost(s)

You can view your boosting streak by tapping on your avatar icon to reveal your profile and hovering over your Server Boosting badge.

GIF showing how to view your Server Boosting badge streak

You can lose your boosting streak for any of the following reasons:

  • You cancel your Server Boost(s)
  • Your Nitro (with 2 included Server Boosts) or your Server Boost(s) subscription has ended
  • The server you have been boosting has been deleted 
  • You’ve been removed from the server by an admin or moderator
Note: If you stop boosting a server for any of the listed reasons, you have 72 hours to reapply your boosts to a new server in order to maintain your streak. If you do not boost another server within 72 hours, you will lose your streak and our Support Team can not adjust your streak.

As long as you keep boosting your favorite server, that badge will continue to evolve while you reach extra levels. 

Example of Server Boost Badge streak evolution                                      

How do I Transfer my Server Boost to Maintain my Streak?

Note: After using your Server Boost, you’ll need to wait 7 days for the cooldown before transferring it to another server.

If you accidentally boosted the wrong server, or you just want to move your boost, you can easily transfer your Server Boost to another server! Just keep in mind, if you move your boost to another server, the original server might lose a server boost level. Here’s how to transfer your boost.

1. Head into your User Settings by pressing the cogwheel [] icon.

 

Cogwheel Icon on Desktop/Browser

2. Navigate to the Server Boost tab.

3. Here you should see the current servers that your Server Boosts are applied to. Tap on the ellipsis [] to the Server Boost that you want to move, and then tap on Transfer Boost.

4. You can either search for the name of the server you want to transfer the boost to, or you can tap on Transfer here if you see the server in the list. In order for a server to show up in the list, you must be a member of the server.

5. Now just tap on Yes, Transfer Boost to transfer the Server Boost.

6. Finally you’ll see a confirmation message stating it has been transferred successfully.

Example of Transferring a Server Boost to Another Server

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: My streak reset and I believe this is incorrect, what should I do? 

A: Discord cannot restore streaks under any circumstances. If you think your streak was incorrectly reset, first verify that you have an active subscription.

If your subscription expired due to past due payments and you had to restart it, remember to manually reapply your server boosts within 72 hours of reactivating your Nitro subscription.

Q: My streak date appears incorrect. What should I do?

A: The streak calculation differs between products: Nitro subscription streaks are based on the subscription date, while Server Boost streaks start from when you begin boosting a server. Since purchases use Universal Time (UTC), the displayed date may differ by up to 24 hours from your local time.

articles.name: How to Connect your Bluesky account to Discord
articles.title: How to Connect your Bluesky account to Discord
articles.body:
What this article covers:
  • What is Bluesky?
  • How to Connect Bluesky to your Discord Account
  • An Unknown Error Occurred. Maybe check your handle?
  • Using a Custom Domain with Bluesky
    • Custom PDS Providers
    • did:web: accounts

What is Bluesky?

Bluesky is a social media platform that allows you to post short messages, photos, videos and more. 

How to Connect Bluesky to your Discord Account

1. Head into your User Settings by pressing the cogwheel [] icon.

2. Tap on the Connections tab and then the Bluesky butterfly icon. 

Connections tab under User Settings

3. Type in your handle for Bluesky and then follow the on-screen instructions to connect your account.

Example of where you enter your Bluesky Account handle

4. You’ll know you’ve successfully connected when you receive this confirmation message:

Confirmation window that your Bluesky account has been connected to Discord

An Unknown Error Occurred. Maybe check your handle?

If we can’t find a Bluesky account associated with the handle you enter, you'll see an error message like this:

Error example when the wrong handle has been entered

This usually means you’ve made a typo when entering the handle, so please make sure to double-check the account name that you have entered. 

If your account uses a custom domain or custom PDS, see Using a Custom Domain with Bluesky below for more details. Otherwise, it’s possible that you may be hitting a temporary server error due to excessive load on the Bluesky network and you’ll have to try connecting your Bluesky account again later.

Using a Custom Domain with Bluesky

In order to link a Bluesky account with a custom-domain handle, Discord will need to look up your account’s DID. This happens when you initially connect the Bluesky account on Discord and then on an ongoing basis to keep your account connected to Discord. 

Verification happens in the same way described in the AT Protocol documentation and the Bluesky blog.

When verifying a domain using the /.well-known/atproto-did method, Discord will use a user-agent string in the form of Discord/1.0 (Discord API; +https://discordapp.com. 

Please ensure that your web server does not block requests with this user-agent, or severely rate-limit requests to this endpoint.

You can simulate the request Discord will make to verify your handle using a curl command in this form: curl -H 'User-Agent: Discord/1.0 (Discord API; +https://discordapp.com)' https://{your-handle-here}/.well-known/atproto-did

Custom PDS Providers

Discord supports linking AT Protocol accounts hosted by third-party PDS providers in the same way as accounts hosted by Bluesky. If hosting your own PDS, please ensure that your web server allows Discord’s user-agent on the authentication and PDS data endpoints, in addition to the /.well-known/atproto-did endpoint.

did:web: accounts

Discord also supports linking AT Protocol accounts that use did:web: identifiers. The requirements for the /.well-known/atproto-did endpoint also apply to the /.well-known/did.json endpoint.

Note: If you run into any issues with linking your Bluesky account to your Discord account, please reach out to our support team through here: http://dis.gd/contact
