articles.name: Evolving Nitro Badges
articles.title: Evolving Nitro Badges
articles.body:
Learn about Discord Nitro's evolving profile badges, which show how long you've been a Nitro subscriber and automatically update to celebrate your membership milestones.

What this article covers:
  • What are Evolving Nitro Badges?
  • How Evolving Badges Work
  • Checking Your Nitro Badge Progress
    • Desktop
    • Mobile
  • Frequently Asked Questions

What are Evolving Nitro Badges?

All Nitro subscribers get a special profile badge when they sign up for Nitro. When you’re subscribed to Nitro, your profile badge will evolve to showcase different designs with each milestone that you reach. 

NOTE: The evolving version of the Nitro badge is not available for Nitro Basic or Classic. 

How Evolving Badges Work

Your Nitro badge will automatically evolve once you’ve reached each subscription milestone. The badge that displays on your profile will be the most recent milestone that you’ve reached. 

Nitro Milestone Badge Evolution

If your Nitro subscription ends at any time and you resubscribe later, your badge progression will start fresh from the beginning. This means you'll need to maintain an active subscription to maintain your badge progress.

Checking Your Nitro Badge Progress

Desktop

To check your current badge level and when you'll reach the next milestone, just hover your cursor over the badge on your profile. You can also check your progress under Direct Messages > Nitro Tab.

On Desktop: Evolving Profile Badge Card in Nitro Tab

Mobile

Evolving Nitro Badges on mobile is currently an experiment available to a limited number of users.

1. To check your current badge level on mobile, tap your avatar in the bottom right corner.  

2. Then tap the cogwheel icon [] to enter your Settings > Manage Nitro.

   

On Mobile: Avatar Icon and Settings Icon (Left), Manage Nitro Settings (Right)

3. In your Nitro Home, you’ll find the Evolving Profile Badge card where you can select See All Badges to view your current badge progress.

 

On Mobile: Evolving Profile Badge Card (Left), Nitro Badge Milestones (Right)

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: What happens to my badge if I cancel or end my Nitro subscription?

A: If you cancel your Nitro subscription, your badge progression will reset. When you resubscribe, you'll start fresh from the beginning of the badge progression.

NOTE: The Discord Support team does not have the ability to update, change, or restore the evolving Nitro badge or any previous badge progress under any circumstances.

Q: Can I keep my evolved badge if I switch between Nitro and Nitro Basic?

A: The evolving version of the Nitro profile badge is only available with Nitro. If you decide to switch your subscription to Nitro Basic, your badge progression will reset and will not evolve. If you re-subscribe to Nitro after subscribing to Nitro Basic, you will start fresh from the beginning of the badge progression. 

Q: How do I view my current badge progress?

A: Simply hover your cursor over the Nitro badge on your profile to see your current level and when you'll reach the next milestone or visit Direct Messages > Nitro Tab > press on the Evolving Profile Badge card to view where you are in the progression of available badges.

Q: Can I choose which badge design to display?

A: No, the badge that is displayed on your profile will be the last milestone you reached and cannot be manually selected.

Q: Can I hide or remove my Nitro badge?

A: No, the Nitro badge cannot be hidden or removed from your profile once earned.

articles.name: Emoji Confetti FAQ
articles.title: Emoji Confetti FAQ
articles.body:
Want to make a Discord message stand out? Emoji Confetti lets you add pizzazz to any message! Sharing your epic gaming moments or posting server announcements is going to be a lot more fun and memorable.

What this article covers:
  • What is Emoji Confetti?
  • Why and When should I use Emoji Confetti?
  • How do I apply Emoji Confetti to a message?
  • Frequently Asked Questions

What is Emoji Confetti?

Emoji Confetti is an experimental feature currently available to select desktop users.

Emoji Confetti adds eye-catching flair to your Discord messages. Pick an emoji and watch it burst as confetti on any message—yours or someone else's—to make it stand out with personality and pizzazz.

Example of Emoji Confetti

Why and When should I use Emoji Confetti?

Emoji Confetti turns ordinary messages into extraordinary ones, going beyond standard emoji reactions to create more fun moments and interactions in your conversations.

Here are moments where adding Emoji Confetti to a message can be a game-changer:

  • Celebrations: If someone posted a message of a gaming milestone or accomplishing a personal goal, shower that message with emoji confetti!
  • Special Announcements: Make important messages stand out in busy conversations or dedicated announcement channels.
  • Spreading Joy & Appreciation: Add confetti to messages to brighten someone’s day or show your appreciation.
  • Just for Fun: Sometimes a conversation needs that extra touch of magic - no special occasion required!

How do I apply Emoji Confetti to a message?

1. To apply Emoji Confetti to a message, select the Add Emoji Confetti icon [] when hovering over a posted message or in the lower-right corner of the text box while typing.

Add Emoji Confetti Icon While Hovering a Message or in Text Chat 

NOTE: As part of this experiment, start your Emoji Confetti fun with 2 free Emoji Confetti!

2. To add Emoji Confetti when typing a message, press the emoji icon [] in the Select an emoji to apply to your message banner located above the text box. Then, choose an emoji from the emoji picker. 

Selecting the Emoji Icon in the Banner Above the Text Box

For a posted message, pick an emoji using the Pick Emoji box. Then, choose an emoji from the emoji picker.

Selecting the Pick Emoji Box to and Choosing an Emoji from the Picker

3. Once you've sent your message or applied confetti to an existing message, you're all set! Hover over the emoji on a message with Emoji Confetti applied to cause an explosion of confetti!

Hovering over Messages with Emoji Confetti

Ready for even more fun? Get a pack of 5 additional Emoji Confetti for $0.99. To purchase more, simply open the Emoji Confetti menu by selecting the Add Emoji Confetti icon [] and press Get 5 more for $0.99.

Get 5 more for $0.99 Button in Emoji Confetti Menu

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: What platforms is Emoji Confetti available on?

A: Currently, Emoji Confetti can only be applied to messages on desktop devices.

Q: Is there a way to disable the Emoji Confetti explosion?

A: The confetti explosion is an opt-in effect that you can choose to trigger. You can disable the Emoji Confetti effect and reduce motion across the app by going to your User Settings > Accessibility > toggle Enable Reduced Motion. You can learn more about reduced motion here.

Q: What’s your refund policy for Emoji Confetti?

A: Emoji Confetti is non-refundable—we cannot provide refunds after purchase or use.

Q: Can I see who applied Emoji Confetti to a message?

A: Yes—simply hover your cursor over the CONFETTI badge on a message to see who applied it.

Example of CONFETTI Badge

Q: Can everyone in the server see Emoji Confetti on a message?
A: Yes, everyone in the server can see Emoji Confetti on a message and trigger the effect. However, Emoji Confetti that you trigger will only appear for you.

Q: Can I remove or change Emoji Confetti after applying it?
A: No, once you’ve applied Emoji Confetti to a message, it cannot be removed or modified.

Q: What happens to Emoji Confetti after the experiment ends?

A: As an experimental feature, Emoji Confetti on messages and any remaining in your inventory may expire in the future.

articles.name: Winter Ringtone and Sounds 2024 FAQ
articles.title: Winter Ringtone and Sounds 2024 FAQ
articles.body:
Note: This sound pack is available on desktop only. This is not available for iOS and Android at this time.

Another year - another happy holiday season! We'll be exchanging our normal Discord call tone for something cheerier. So grab a friend and give them a call, or have them call you! Listen for festive and merry sound effects throughout as well!

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: How long will this sound pack be available?

A: The Winter sound pack will be available from December 19, 2024 - January 3, 2025.

Q: Where can I enable this sound pack?

A: The Winter sound pack should be available automatically.

If you've disabled the Holiday sound pack, you can re-enable it. Go to User Settings > Notifications.

Then select ❄️ Winter from the Event Sound Pack dropdown menu.

Winter Event Sound Pack in Notifications Settings

Q: Will this be available on all devices and clients?

A: The Winter sound pack will be available only on our desktop and browser clients. This soundpack is not available for iOS and Android at this time.

Q: Can I disable this sound pack and revert back to the default sound pack?

A: For desktop users, you'll be able to go to User Settings > Notifications. Then select Discord Default from the Event Sound Pack dropdown menu.

How to Revert Event Sound Pack to Discord Default in Notifications Settings

Note: If you have the Incoming Ring setting disabled, this will also automatically disable the Winter sound pack.

Q: Can I download this sound pack?

A: Sadly, there is no downloadable file for the sound pack and is only available in-client until January 3, 2025.

articles.name: Safe Ways to Shop on Discord
articles.title: Safe Ways to Shop on Discord
articles.body:
Looking for safe ways to buy Discord Nitro and other premium features? Learn how to protect your account and payment information by purchasing through official Discord channels only.

From accessing Nitro perks to enjoying premium features, ensuring your purchases are made through authorized platforms is key to protecting your Discord account.

Purchases from unauthorized sellers can potentially lead to revoked purchases or compromised personal and payment information. This article will help you understand the official ways to purchase Discord products and stay safe while enjoying all that Discord has to offer.

What this article covers:
  • Official Ways to Buy or Receive Discord Products
  • What Can You Do If You Suspect You’ve Been Scammed?
    • How to Stay Informed to Stay Safe
  • Frequently Asked Questions

Official Ways to Buy or Receive Discord Products

The secure way to purchase Nitro or other Discord products is directly through Discord or our official Amazon store (available in select countries).

Here’s how you can purchase or receive Nitro and other products on Discord:

  • Direct Purchase: Buy Nitro and Server Boosts through the Nitro Tab in your Direct Messages List or under User Settings > Billing Settings 
  • Gift Inventory: Check and manage your purchased or received Nitro gifts within the app. Gifts sent through Discord can only be redeemed on the platform. Learn how to securely claim a Nitro gift in our Nitro Gifting FAQ.
  • Profile Purchases: Customize your experience by purchasing Profile Cosmetics and Effects through the Shop Tab in your Direct Messages List or under User Settings > Profile
  • Share Nitro Program: As a subscription perk for Nitro subscribers, you can share three 2-week trial passes with friends who don't already have Nitro. This official program is a secure way to spread the fun. For more details, check out our Share Nitro article.
  • Quests and Promotions: We're proud of Nitro and want you to experience it firsthand! That's why we regularly offer opportunities to try it before buying. Check out our Quests & Promotions page to see all current offers.

If you ever encounter a promotion or offer for Nitro, make sure it comes from one of the trusted sources outlined above. Avoid clicking on suspicious links or interacting with third-party sellers offering discounts or giveaways.

Discord's premium products can only be purchased directly through the Discord app or our official Amazon store (available in select countries). Buying Discord Nitro or other official products from unauthorized sources puts you at risk of scams.

What Can You Do If You Suspect You’ve Been Scammed? 

If you suspect you’ve been scammed or purchased Discord products from an unauthorized seller:

1. Contact Support: Reach out to our support team at https://dis.gd/billing for assistance.

2. Report Fraud: Report the issue at https://dis.gd/howtoreport to help us take action against scammers.

Please note that Discord cannot mediate financial disputes or issue refunds for purchases made through unauthorized third-party sellers.

How to Stay Informed to Stay Safe

Scammers are constantly looking for ways to exploit users. Always double-check that your purchases and gifts come from the official Discord sources described in this article. For more guidance on avoiding scams, check out these resources:

  • Understanding and Avoiding Common Scams
  • Deceptive Practices Policy Explainer
  • Claiming a Nitro Gift FAQ
  • Shop FAQ
  • Server Boosting FAQ

By staying vigilant and following these tips, you can enjoy Discord’s premium features with peace of mind.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: How do you identify a third-party seller?

A: Third-party sellers are unauthorized individuals or websites that offer Discord products at discounted prices or through unofficial channels. These sellers often advertise through unsolicited messages, social media, or unofficial websites. To identify them, look for offers that require external payments, unusual URLs, or methods that don’t involve the Discord app or official Amazon store. Remember: if it’s not from a Discord source described in this article, it’s not official.

Q: What does a phishing attempt look like?

A: Phishing attempts often appear as fake messages or links designed to trick you into providing sensitive information, like your login credentials or payment details. Common signs include:

  • Messages claiming you’ve won or received free products or rewards, like Nitro, but requiring you to click a suspicious link.
  • Threats to your account status unless you take immediate action.
  • Requests for your password, account login, or personal information.

Discord will never ask for your login details or for your payment information through unsolicited messages. Always verify links and contact Discord support directly if you’re unsure.

Q: What are safe messaging practices to avoid unsolicited scams?

A: To protect yourself from unsolicited messages and scams:

  • Avoid engaging with messages from unknown users, especially those offering deals or rewards.
  • Enable Safe Direct Messaging under User Settings > Privacy & Safety to automatically scan DMs from non-friends for harmful content.
  • Report suspicious messages or users by following the steps outlined here.
  • Never click on links from untrusted sources. Even if they appear to come from someone you know, accounts can be compromised.

If you ever need to verify if a source is a legitimate Discord source or not, you can reach out to the Discord support team.

articles.name: Why Does My Payment Show As A Pending Charge?
articles.title: Why Does My Payment Show As A Pending Charge?
articles.body:
What this article covers:
  • What is a Pending Charge?
  • What if I See Multiple Pending Charges?

What is a Pending Charge?

Example of a Pending purchase in the Billing tab

If you see a pending charge on Discord, this indicates that the charge was unsuccessful because it requires further verification from your bank or card provider. You’ll need to reach out to your payment provider for steps on how to correct this pending charge. 

If the pending charge isn't resolved, it will automatically cancel within 3 days. The status of the charge will then change to Failed in your User Settings > Billing. If a pending charge still appears on your bank statement, it should be removed within 5-10 business days.

What if I see Multiple Pending Charges?

The only time you may see multiple pending charges are when your payments have not been successfully processed, or they’re in a Past Due state. 

When renewing a subscription and your renewal payment does not successfully go through, we will attempt the purchase again to ensure that your subscription goes uninterrupted. Once a payment successfully goes through, our system will attempt to cancel all other pending payments. 

Note: If you are still seeing the pending charge after 10 business days, you can reach out to the Billing Support team for them to review through here: dis.gd/billing

articles.name: Why is My Payment Showing as Failed or Invalid?
articles.title: Why is My Payment Showing as Failed or Invalid?
articles.body:
What this article covers:
  • Why is My Payment Showing As Failed?
  • Why is My Payment showing as Invalid Payment?

Why is my Payment Showing As Failed?

Billing tab under User Settings on desktop/browser

There are several reasons that can cause a payment to fail. To figure out what’s going on, we recommend following the steps below:

1. Ensure that the billing address associated with the card being charged is current and matches the information filed with your bank. You can learn how to manage your billing information here.

2. Ensure your card details are entered correctly.

3. Ensure the card hasn’t expired.

4. Depending on the card, ensure there are sufficient funds in the account or that the credit limit hasn’t been exceeded.

5. It’s possible a pre-set spending limit on the card was reached. Double-check if a spending limit has been set.

Note: If issues persist after following the steps above, Discord's Support team cannot provide further assistance. We recommend contacting your bank or using another payment method.

Why is my Payment showing as Invalid Payment?

If you’re receiving an Invalid payment error message, it means there is an error with the payment method you are trying to use. Please review the information you provided and try again. 

Example of an Invalid payment message when making a purchase

Note: If you’re still getting an error message, please reach out to our Support team for further assistance through here: dis.gd/billing

articles.name: Discord Advertising IAB Addendum
articles.title: Discord Advertising IAB Addendum
articles.body:
This Discord Advertising IAB Addendum (this “Discord Addendum”), which amends and supplements the IAB STANDARD TERMS AND CONDITIONS FOR INTERNET ADVERTISING FOR MEDIA BUYS ONE YEAR OR LESS VERSION 3.0 (the “IAB Terms” and collectively with this Discord Addendum, the “Campaign Terms”), governs and forms a part of any applicable insertion order  (the “IO”) signed by and between Discord Inc. (“Media Company”) and the advertiser designated on an IO (“Advertiser”), or, if applicable, Advertiser’s agency designated on an IO (“Agency”).  The terms of this Discord Addendum will control over and fully supersede any similar, conflicting, inconsistent or overlapping terms in the IAB Terms or other parts of an IO; however, if an IO expressly states that certain terms set forth in the IO are intended to supersede the terms of this Discord Addendum, then, in the event of conflict, those terms of the applicable IO will control only for that IO and only to the extent of such conflict. Any purchase order terms, “clickthrough” or other online agreements, or other similar documents made available to Media Company by Advertiser or Agency are hereby rejected by Media Company and will not apply to any Quest. Capitalized terms used but not defined herein will have the meanings given to such terms in the IAB Terms. 

Where Advertiser is purchasing directly from Media Company, (i) Section 2 and any references to Agency herein will be deemed deleted and will not apply; and (ii) all references in the IAB Terms to Agency, will be deemed to be references to Advertiser.

1. Quest Terms.

a. Quests. Media Company will implement a promotional campaign on its platform (the “Discord Platform”) for Advertiser’s applicable property designated on an IO (the “Advertiser Property”) where eligible users of the Discord Platform will be able to complete certain agreed-upon tasks relating to the Advertiser Property and earn certain agreed-upon rewards (“Rewards”), as further detailed in an applicable IO (each such campaign, a “Quest”).  

b. Quest T&Cs. Media Company will, in consultation with Advertiser or Agency, as applicable, establish the specific terms and requirements for users governing each Quest (“Quest T&Cs”), and will publish the Quest T&Cs to users in connection with such Quest. The Quest T&Cs will address, at a minimum (i) user eligibility requirements and any criteria and tasks that must be satisfied by a user in order to receive a Reward; (ii) the nature of the applicable Reward, including whether the Reward will be supplied by Media Company (each, a “Media Company Reward”) or Advertiser (each, an “Advertiser Reward”); and (iv) any other terms, conditions and limitations pertaining to the redemption and use of the Reward.  

c. Advertiser Rewards. Unless otherwise indicated on an IO, the Reward will be an Advertiser Reward approved by Media Company and either the Advertiser or Agency, as applicable. For any Quest with an Advertiser Reward: (i) reasonably in advance of the applicable flight dates for a Quest, the parties will agree in writing (email to suffice) on and implement the fulfillment and redemption mechanics for the Advertiser Reward, which may consist of the delivery to Media Company of a sufficient number of redemption codes for users to redeem for Advertiser Rewards; (ii) Advertiser or Agency, as applicable, will ensure that the Advertiser Reward and the redemption process is consistent with the Quest T&Cs; and (iii) in the event of any fulfillment or redemption issues (including, without limitation, insufficient or defective redemption codes) in connection with a Quest, Media Company may suspend such Quest until such issues are resolved.  For clarity, Advertiser is solely responsible for the Advertiser Rewards and any associated fraud, losses, or other issues in connection with such Advertiser Rewards. 

d. Media Company Rewards.  For any Quest where the applicable IO indicates there will be a Media Company Reward, Media Company will (i) ensure that such Media Company Reward and redemption process is consistent with the Quest T&Cs; and (ii) will have responsibility (unless otherwise agreed in the IO) and control over the design and creation of such Media Company Reward. Media Company will obtain Advertiser’s or Agency’s approval (not to be unreasonably withheld) for any Media Company Reward that contains or is derived from Advertising Materials. Media Company Rewards may not be available to users in certain regions where not supported by the Discord Platform. Advertiser and Agency may not terminate for convenience any Quest with (i) a Media Company Reward that contains or is derived from Advertising Materials or (ii) any other custom Media Company Reward created specifically for the Quest. 

e. Advertiser Marks License. 

i. Advertiser and Agency hereby grant Media Company a limited, non-exclusive, royalty-free license to use and display Advertiser’s name, designated trademarks and associated logos, and any names, trademarks or logos associated with the Advertiser Property (the “Advertiser Marks”) in connection with the implementation of a Quest, the performance of Media Company’s obligations under the Campaign Terms and any IO, or as otherwise approved in writing by Advertiser or Agency. 

ii. All goodwill and improved reputation generated by Media Company’s use of the Advertiser Marks inures to the exclusive benefit of Advertiser. Media Company will use the Advertiser Marks in a manner consistent with any branding guidelines provided by Advertiser to Media Company in writing.

f. Advertising Materials.  Advertiser and Agency hereby grant Media Company a limited, non-exclusive, royalty-free license to use, display, adapt, translate, modify, copy, publicly perform, transmit and distribute the Advertising Materials in connection with the implementation or promotion of a Quest, the performance of Media Company’s obligations under the Campaign Terms or as otherwise approved by Advertiser or Agency, as applicable, including, without limitation, in connection with the development, distribution and making available of applicable Media Company Rewards containing or derived from such Advertising Materials. The licenses set forth herein are sublicensable by Media Company to its affiliates, agents, and subcontractors in connection with Media Company performance hereunder (and, with respect to Media Company Rewards containing or derived from Advertising Materials, to end users who claim any such Media Company Rewards in connection with a Quest). Advertiser or Agency, as applicable, will, at its own cost and expense, obtain all necessary licenses, consents, approvals and permissions from any third party required for Media Company to exercise its rights under the foregoing license. For purposes of the Campaign Terms, “Advertising Materials” means any content, materials, copy, branding, images, names, audio, music, video, artwork, designs, descriptions, specifications, and other elements made available by Advertiser or Agency to Media Company for use in connection with a Quest, including, without limitation, any elements, materials, assets or intellectual property from the Advertiser Property. 

g. Cooperation.  Media Company’s ability to implement the Quest and its obligations under the Campaign Terms and any IO (including, without limitation, the ability to meet the applicable timeframes and schedules for a Quest as specified in an IO) will be contingent upon the timely provision of cooperation from Advertiser or Agency, as applicable, in connection with the Quest, which cooperation includes, without limitation, providing any redemption codes, Advertising Materials and/or Advertiser Rewards as required by Media Company with sufficient lead time for the applicable Quest, compliance with applicable Policies or other campaign and asset specifications, and timely feedback, reviews and approvals for any items and matters requiring approval or input in connection with a Quest. Advertiser and Agency will adhere to any Policies and other agreed upon timeframes, campaign specifications, and development schedules in connection with the foregoing. Media Company will not be liable or responsible for any delays or issues caused by Advertiser’s or Agency’s failure or delay in providing such cooperation.

h. Quest Prompts.  Media Company will be responsible for developing, producing, and displaying prompts or notifications promoting the availability of a Quest (“Quest Prompts”) to certain users on applicable surfaces within the Discord Platform. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, Media Company will have ultimate authority and control over the content, placement, frequency, delivery, timing and accompanying disclosures in connection with all Quest Prompts on the Discord Platform. Media Company reserves the right to suspend or cancel the targeting, personalization, and/or delivery of Quest Prompts in connection with any Quest.  

i. Reporting.  For each Quest, Media Company will provide summary reports to Advertiser or Agency, as applicable, regarding certain estimated performance metrics, insights and KPIs within a reasonable timeframe after the midpoint and end date of such Quest. The information in such reports may be used by Advertiser solely for its own internal business purposes but will otherwise be considered Media Company’s Confidential Information. 

j. Estimates.  Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, any impression or reach numbers, impression-related commitments, targeting parameters, geographies or estimates provided on an IO and any information provided in connection with any report delivered by Media Company with respect to any Quest are provided by Media Company solely on an “AS IS” basis as estimates for informational purposes based on the data reasonably available to Media Company and are not guaranteed or considered binding by the parties in connection with any Quest. Media Company will not be liable (or required to offer any makegood) for any errors, shortfalls, inaccuracies or omissions in connection with any of the foregoing.

2. Agency Authority.  Agency represents, warrants and covenants that it has obtained and will maintain all consents, approvals and authorizations from Advertiser necessary for Agency to (i) bind Advertiser to the Campaign Terms and any IO, act on behalf of Advertiser and otherwise comply with its obligations in connection with the Campaign Terms and any IO, including, without limitation, with respect to (a) the execution of any IOs on Advertiser’s behalf, (b) the ability to pay Media Company for any Quest; (c) the ability to share Advertiser’s Confidential Information with Media Company; and (c) the management and provision of any and all approvals, feedback and reviews in connection with the Campaign Terms and any IO (e.g., the review and approval of Rewards and other Quest elements, press releases, promotional materials, or creative assets); and (ii) grant the licenses set forth in the Campaign Terms and any IO, including, without limitation, any such licenses to Advertiser Marks and Advertising Materials set forth herein. Media Company will be entitled to rely on any documents executed, instructions provided or approvals granted by Agency on an Advertiser’s behalf in connection with the Campaign Terms and any IO. Agency will indemnify and hold Media Company harmless from and against any losses or unpaid obligations under any IOs arising from Agency’s violation of this Section. 

3. Taxes. Unless otherwise stated in an IO, Media Company’s fees do not include any direct or indirect local, state, federal or foreign taxes, levies, duties or similar governmental assessments of any nature, including value-added, use, sales or withholding taxes collected by any jurisdiction. Each party is responsible for all of its own business taxes (including, but not limited to, net income, gross receipts, franchise, or other similar business taxes) arising as a result of or in connection with any IO. Advertiser or Agency, as applicable, is responsible for self-assessing any transaction taxes (e.g. sales tax, VAT, GST or similar taxes) due with respect to any IO. Media Company will collect, and Advertiser or Agency, as applicable, will pay any applicable transaction taxes if Media Company determines that it has a duty to collect such taxes. Advertiser or Agency, as applicable, is responsible for any transaction taxes on user rewards redeemed outside of the Discord Platform. For transaction tax purposes, Quests will be treated as services related to promotional advertising campaigns. To the extent withholding tax is required by applicable law, Advertiser or Agency, as applicable, will be responsible for collecting and remitting such taxes to the appropriate tax authorities. Additionally, Advertiser or Agency, as applicable, will provide Media Company an original receipt or documentation from the tax authority for the withholding tax payments.

4. Amendments to IAB Terms. 

a. General Acknowledgements.  The parties acknowledge and agree that: (i) Quests are treated as flat-fee based Deliverables delivered on the Discord Platform for purposes of the IAB Terms; (ii) the terms of the IAB Terms relating to inventory availability, delivery schedule, ad placement and positioning, use of collected data, and reporting will be superseded and governed by the applicable terms of Section 1 of this Discord Addendum and any IO; and (iii) Quests do not use or involve any Third Party Ad Server and any associated terms in the IAB Terms do not apply.

b. Specific Amendments. 

i. Section X(b) of the IAB Terms is hereby amended to add the following new subclauses (iv) and (v):

“(iv) allegations that the Advertising Materials or Advertiser Marks infringe, misappropriate or otherwise violate any intellectual property rights of a third party; or (v) Advertiser Rewards, including, without limitation, any claims from users that Advertiser Rewards were misleading or inaccurate or that they were not properly fulfilled.”

ii. Section XI of the IAB Terms is hereby amended and restated as follows:

“Excluding Agency’s, Advertiser’s, and Media Company’s respective indemnification obligations under the Campaign Terms, damages that result from a breach of Section XII, or intentional misconduct by Agency, Advertiser, or Media Company, in no event will any party be liable (i) for any consequential, indirect, incidental, punitive, special, or exemplary damages whatsoever or any damages for loss of profits, business interruption, loss of information, and the like, incurred by another party arising out of an IO, even if such party has been advised of the possibility of such damages; or (ii) in the aggregate in connection with these Campaign Terms or the IO in excess of the amount paid or payable by Agency or Advertiser to Media Company hereunder.”

iii. For purposes of Section XIV(d) of the IAB Terms, the choice of law governing any IO will be the State of New York without reference to its choice of law rules, and all claims, legal proceedings or litigations arising in connection with the Campaign Terms will be brought solely in state and federal courts located in New York City.

iv. Section XIV.e of the IAB Terms is hereby amended and restated as follows:

“All notices of termination or breach must be in English, in writing and addressed to the other party’s legal department (with a copy to any contact listed on an IO). The email address for notices being sent to the Media Company legal department is legal.notices@discordapp.com. All other notices must be in English, in writing (including email) and addressed to the other party’s applicable notice information designated on an IO. Notice will be treated as given on receipt, as verified by written or automated receipt or by electronic log (as applicable).”

articles.name: How to Request a Refund from Discord
articles.title: How to Request a Refund from Discord
articles.body:
You can request a refund for your Discord subscription if it meets our Refund Policy requirements. Simply find your payment ID and submit your request to the Discord Billing Support Team.

What this article covers:
  • How to Find your Payment ID
    • Desktop/Browser
    • Mobile
  • How to Request a Refund
NOTE: Before requesting a refund, check out our Refund Policy to ensure your purchase is eligible.

How to Find your Payment ID

NOTE: You can only locate your payment ID within the desktop app or browser.

Before submitting a request for a refund, you’ll need to make sure you have the payment ID for the purchase that you’d like refunded. This helps us process your request quickly and ensure we refund the correct purchase.

Desktop/Browser

1. Head into your User Settings by pressing the cogwheel [] icon.

 

Cogwheel Icon on Desktop/Browser

2. Tap Billing, then select  the purchase for which you need the  payment ID.

3. The payment ID will appear in the dropdown menu. You can copy this ID and paste it into the support form.

Example of a Payment ID in the Billing tab of Discord’s User Settings

Mobile

NOTE: For any purchases (besides a Server Subscription) made on Discord using your iOS device, you will need to request a refund for those purchases via the iOS App Store. If you’re wanting to request a refund for a Server Subscription purchase, you can follow the steps below to obtain a payment ID.

In order to get your payment ID for a mobile purchase, please refer to the confirmation email you received with your purchase. This will include the payment ID.

For Android users, you can provide a payment ID, however, another option that provides a quicker turnaround is your GPA number from your Google Play Store confirmation email. If you’re unable to find your confirmation email from Google Play, you can check out their guide here on how to locate the GPA number.

If you can’t locate your confirmation email, you can obtain your payment ID through the desktop app or browser by following the steps above.

Confirmation email showing the Payment ID after making a purchase

How to Request a Refund

NOTE: Make sure when filling out the form you’re providing the email address that is tied to your Discord account.

1. Once you have your Payment ID, head to the Support form. 

2. Fill out each question in the form as it pertains to your billing request. Make sure to enter the Payment ID where requested.

3. After submitting your request you should receive a confirmation email letting you know your ticket has been received.

4. You will receive a response from the team once your ticket has been handled. 

NOTE: For any questions about refunds or billing matters, please contact the Discord Support team

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: How can I request a refund for my Discord subscription?

A: You can request a refund by finding your payment ID and submitting a request to the Discord Billing Support Team. Make sure your request meets the Refund Policy requirements.

Q: What do I need before requesting a refund?

A: You need to:

  • Review the Discord Refund Policy to ensure your purchase is eligible
  • Have your payment ID ready
  • Use the email address associated with your Discord account

Q: How do I find my payment ID on desktop/browser?

1. Open User Settings via the cogwheel icon

2. Go to Billing and select the relevant purchase

3. Find the payment ID in the dropdown menu

Q: What if I made purchases on iOS or Android?

A: To request a refund from Apple, you will need to request a refund for those purchases via the iOS App Store.

 Android users need to provide the GPA number from their Google Play Store confirmation email instead of a payment ID. If you’re unable to find your confirmation email from Google Play, you can check out their guide here on how to locate the GPA number.

Q: What happens after I submit my refund request?

A: You'll receive:

  • An immediate confirmation email of your ticket submitted to our Support team
  • A response once your ticket has been processed

Q: What if I can’t find my payment ID?

A: If you can’t locate your payment ID in the Billing tab, you can obtain it from the confirmation email. If you still can’t locate it, please submit a request to the Discord Support team under the email address tied to your Discord account.

articles.name: How to Ignore Users on Discord
articles.title: How to Ignore Users on Discord
articles.body:
Discover how to use Discord's Ignore feature - a helpful tool that lets you make space from specific users without fully blocking them or letting them know. With Ignore, you can hide new messages, DM and server message notifications, profiles, and activities from those specific users, giving you more control over your experience on Discord. This article explains how to ignore users and how to manage ignored users.

What this article covers:
  • What is the Ignore Feature?
  • How to Ignore a User
    • When Viewing a User’s Profile 
    • In Safety Tools and Safety Alerts
    • After Submitting a Report
    • In a Direct Message
  • Managing Your Ignore List
    • Desktop/Browser
    • Mobile
  • How to Un-Ignore a User
  • Frequently Asked Questions

What is the Ignore Feature?

In addition to Blocking and Muting, Discord also lets users ignore specific users.

When ignoring a user, here's what happens:

  • When a user is ignored, their direct messages (DM) appear darkened. You'll also see the Ignore [] icon next to their messages.

DM with an Ignore Icon 

  • Their messages will be hidden in DMs, group chats, and servers. If you want to view these ignored messages, simply press the Show button.

Show Button For Ignored Message

  • Before viewing an ignored user's profile, you'll see a warning screen. Their profile will display their ignored status.

 

Warning Screens: Ignored User's Profile (Left) and Profile Ignore Status (Right)

  • If you attempt to join a voice or video call that includes someone you've ignored, you'll receive a warning before connecting.

Example of Voice or Video Warning

How to Ignore a User

There are a few different places to find this setting for each user. You will see the Ignore option when:

When Viewing a User’s Profile 

  1. To ignore a specific user, right-click the user’s avatar to open the drop-down menu. 
  2. Select the Ignore option.
  3. After making your selection, press Ignore in the confirmation pop-up window.

How to Ignore a User While Viewing a User’s Profile on Desktop

To ignore a user on mobile, tap their avatar, then tap the ellipsis [] in the upper-right corner > Ignore.

 

How to Ignore a User While Viewing a User’s Profile on Mobile

In Safety Tools and Safety Alerts

Safety tools and Safety Alerts warn teen users when we detect potentially inappropriate messages. Teens can choose to select the Ignore option when these tools and alerts appear.

 

Safety Tools Ignore Option: Desktop (Left) vs. Mobile (Right)

After Submitting a Report

To ignore a user, right-click the message you would like to report and press Report Message. After submitting a report, you will be able to select the Ignore option in the More you can do menu.     

 

Message Reporting: Right-Click Menu (Left) and Ignore Option in "More You Can Do" Menu (Right)

On mobile, long press the message you would like to report and tap Report. After the report has been submitted, you will be able to ignore the user.

After Report Submission: Mobile Ignore Option

In a Direct Message

1. To ignore a specific user in a DM, right-click the user’s avatar to open the drop-down menu. 

2. Select the Ignore option. 

3. After making your selection, press Ignore in the confirmation pop-up window.

How to Ignore a User in DMs on Desktop

On mobile, tap the user in DMs, then select the ellipsis [] > Ignore and confirm your choice. 

How to Ignore a User in DMs on Mobile

Managing the Accounts You’ve Ignored 

Desktop/Browser

To manage the accounts you’ve ignored on desktop or browser, you can view your list at any time by going to your User Settings [] > Content & Social. There you'll find the Accounts you've blocked & ignored list.  

Content & Social on Desktop: Accounts You’ve Blocked & Ignored List

Mobile

1. On mobile, you can view your list of ignored users by tapping your avatar in the bottom-right corner. 

Avatar Icon on Mobile

2. Then, tap the cogwheel [] in the upper-right corner to navigate to Settings > Content & Social.

3. There you can scroll down to the Accounts you've blocked & ignored list where you can tap Ignored accounts.  

Content & Social on Mobile: Accounts You’ve Blocked & Ignored List

How to Un-Ignore a User

You can un-ignore a user at any time. Here are three ways to do this on desktop or browser: 

1. Un-Ignore from Friend List: Right-clicking the ignored user in your Friends List, then select Unignore.

Un-ignoring a User in the Friends List

2. Un-Ignore from Profile: Select the ellipsis [] and press Unignore or use the Unignore button next to the You ignored them notice.

Unignore Options in a User’s Profile

3. Un-Ignore in Content & Social: Go to User Settings > Content & Social. Then scroll to the Accounts you've blocked & ignored list and select Unignore next to the specific user you would like to un-ignore.  

Un-ignoring a User in Content & Social

On mobile, tap the user's avatar, then select the ellipsis [] > Unignore. Alternatively, go to Settings > Content & Social > Accounts you've blocked or ignored, then tap Unignore in the Ignored accounts list. 

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Will the user know that I ignored them?

A: No, they will not be able to visually detect in their Discord experience that you have ignored their account. 

Q: Can ignored users still see my messages?

A: Yes, they can still view your messages and profile. They will not be able to visually detect in their Discord experience that you have ignored their account. 

Q: What's the difference between blocking and ignoring?

A: What Happens When You Ignore Someone:

Feature Your Experience The Ignored User’s Experience
Direct Messages You can still send them direct messages. Their messages to you will be hidden without notifications. They can still message you (but you won’t get notifications).
Messages in shared spaces You can still tag or reply to their messages. Their messages to you will be hidden without notifications. They can still message, tag, and interact with you (but you won’t get notifications).
Profile Visibility Their profile is hidden unless you choose to unhide it. They can see your full profile.
Activity Visibility Limited activity visibility; some group activity may still show. They can see your online presence and activity.
Friendship Status Friends are not removed; if you are not friends, their friend requests go to the friend request inbox without alerts. They remain your friend, or non-friends can still send new friend requests.

What Happens When You Block Someone:

Feature Your Experience The Blocked User’s Experience
Direct Messages You cannot send messages to a blocked user. They cannot message you
Messages in shared spaces You can still tag or reply to their messages. Their messages to you will be hidden without notifications. They can still message, tag, and interact with you (but you won’t get notifications).
Profile Visibility Their profile is hidden unless you choose to unhide it. They see a limited version of your profile.
Activity Visibility Limited activity visibility; some group activity may still show. Limited activity visibility; some group activity may still show.
Friendship Status Friendship is removed, and they cannot send new friend requests. They are unfriended and see an error when trying to re-add you.

articles.name: In-game Features Powered by Discord FAQ
articles.title: In-game Features Powered by Discord FAQ
articles.body:
Discord has launched an integration for game developers to power various social and communication features within their games. For you, it means some aspects of your in-game experience (such as in-game voice or friends lists) will be powered by Discord.

This means you can enjoy everything you love about Discord directly in your game, even without a Discord account. Connect and play with friends through seamless cross-platform messaging, voice chat, and other powerful features. It’s never been easier to keep the party going—whether you’re actively playing or just hanging out.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Does that mean I need a registered Discord account to play the game?

A: Players will not be required to connect a registered Discord account to play games that integrate Discord-powered social features.

Q: Can I exchange messages with my friends on Discord while playing this game?

A: Yes, in some games, players are able to exchange messages with friends across Discord while they’re in-game, even if their friends aren’t playing in the same game.

Q: Will this integration impact my game performance?

A: These integrations are designed to avoid impacting game performance.

Q: Am I required to use the in-game features that enable me to send/receive Discord messages and view my Discord friends from within a game?

A: No, the social features that enable you to to send/receive Discord messages and view your Discord friends from within a game are optional. You can choose whether to use them.

Q: Do I need to connect my Discord account to view my Discord friends on my in-game friends list? 

A: Yes. If you want to view your Discord friends on your in-game friends list, you will need to connect your Discord account.

Q: Do I need to connect my Discord account to be able to send or receive messages in the game?

A: You can use the game’s messaging features without connecting your Discord account. In-game communication functions, such as direct messages with friends, can work without the need for a connected Discord account.

If you choose to connect your Discord account, you'll gain the added convenience of sending and receiving some of those same in-game messages on Discord. The connection simply extends where you can access your conversations – your friends can continue chatting with you in-game even if they haven't connected their own Discord accounts.

Q: What will the game developer be able to do with my Discord messages?

A: Before connecting your Discord account, you'll see a clear permissions screen outlining the data that you’re authorizing the game to receive from your Discord account. Developers are only permitted to use this data to power the integration, which includes accessing messages that appear in their game for moderation purposes.  

For more information about the developer’s data practices, please review the developer’s Terms of Service and Privacy Policy. You can review and revoke your account connection at any time through your Discord Connections tab within the User Settings.

Q: What will Discord do with my messages from the game that appear in Discord?

A: Messages sent from the game that appear on Discord are treated like any other message on Discord consistent with Discord's Terms of Service and Privacy Policy. 

Q: Which messages from the game will be synced with Discord?

A: Direct Messages with a Discord user or in-game friends will be shown in Discord. 

Lobby text messages will not be in Discord, unless that lobby is linked to a Discord channel. 

Messages in Linked Channels will be displayed in Discord, regardless of whether an account is linked.

Q: If I'm messaging someone on Discord, how can I tell when they’re messaging me from within a game?

A: When a user has sent a message from within a game, a controller icon will appear next to their name as a visual indicator.

Q: How can I tell when I’m sending messages in a Linked Channel? 

A: There are a few visual indicators that you are viewing a Linked Channel while on Discord. You will see a controller icon at the top right corner of the channel symbol. You will also see the title of the game that’s linked. 

In the desktop app, it will be next to the channel name in the header; in the mobile app, it will be in the channel profile. In addition, a system message will be sent in the channel notifying members that the channel has been linked to a game.

NOTE: If you’re running into an issue connecting your Discord account to your game, please reach out to the game developer for further assistance. Discord Support is not able to assist with in-game connection of accounts.

articles.name: Leaderboards FAQ
articles.title: Leaderboards FAQ
articles.body:
Leaderboards on Discord allows you to share your game/activity/app stats and compete with others in your server. Learn more about how to use Leaderboards in your Discord server!

What this article covers:
    • What Are Leaderboards?
    • How to View Leaderboards
    • How to Join Leaderboards
    • How Leaderboard Competition Works
    • Leaderboard Controls
      • How to Leave a Leaderboard
      • How to Customize Your Server’s Leaderboard

What Are Leaderboards?

Note: This is currently an experimental feature and is only available to a limited number of League of Legends players on desktop (Windows and Mac OS) and browser.

Leaderboards allow users to share their stats for a game, activity or application, and compete against other members in a server.

Leaderboards via the Desktop App

How to View Leaderboards

For servers in the experiment, a Leaderboard will appear on the Recent Activity section of the Member List. 

League of Legends Displayed as Activity Status in Members List

By hovering over the League of Legends activity in the Members List, you can view the Leaderboard for the server and see where everyone ranks.

Selecting a User in the Leaderboard

How to Join Leaderboards

In order to join Leaderboards, you will need to connect your League of Legends account to your Discord account. If you haven’t connected your League of Legends account already, there are two ways to do this.

Connecting Through the Leaderboard

1. With the Leaderboard opened, tap on Join Leaderboard at the bottom and then follow the prompts to connect your League of Legends account to Discord.

“Join Leaderboard” Button in the Leaderboard

Connecting in User Settings

1. Press on the cogwheel [] in the bottom-left corner to access your User Settings .

2. Select Connections and then choose League of Legends to connect your account.

Connections Tab within User Settings

3. After following the prompts, your League of Legends account will be connected to your Discord account. You can learn more about Connections through the Connections & Linked Roles: Community Members Help Center article. 

How Leaderboard Competition Works

Here's everything you need to know to participate and track your progress:

Viewing the Leaderboard
  • Find the leaderboard in the Recent Activity section of the server's members list.
  • Leaderboards are based on various League of Legends stats, including:
    • Wins
    • Kills
    • Damage taken
  • We may introduce additional stats in future updates.
Rank Updates
  • Your stats and rank updates automatically within 30 minutes after each match.
  • Discord fetches your latest match stats to keep the leaderboard current.
Rewards and Recognition
  • The #1 ranked player receives a special icon next to their name in the server.
  • Leaderboards reset weekly, giving everyone a fresh chance to compete.
Sharing Your Achievements
  • Want to showcase your rank? Simply copy a player's rank from the leaderboard.
  • Paste the rank in any text channel to share with the community.

Example of a User’s Ranking

Leaderboard Controls

How to Leave a Leaderboard

You can remove yourself from a server’s leaderboard by tapping on the ellipsis [] and  selecting Leave Leaderboard.

“Leave Leaderboard” Button

How to Customize Your Server’s Leaderboard

Members with the Manage Server permissions enabled can customize how the Leaderboard behaves in the server. 

Manager Server Permission 

1. With the Leaderboard opened, tap on the ellipsis [] and then select Manage Settings. 

Manage Settings Option in Leaderboards

2. There are two ways to customize the leaderboard:

  • Select a different stat as the basis for competition (e.g., kills, deaths, assists, damage taken or dealt, and wins).
  • Disable the role icon in chat.

Leaderboard Settings

articles.name: HD Splash Potion FAQ
articles.title: HD Splash Potion FAQ
articles.body:
HD Splash Potion allows everyone in a voice channel to enjoy HD video streaming quality for the next 12 hours without Nitro and Server Boosts.

What this article covers:
  • What is the HD Splash Potion?
  • Why and when should I use an HD Splash Potion?
  • How do I activate and use my HD Splash Potion?
  • Frequently Asked Questions
HD Splash Potions are currently an experimental feature, available only to select desktop users.

What is the HD Splash Potion?

Why, adventurer, you may have stumbled into a curious, new trinket on Discord…

The HD Splash Potion is a new feature that grants the magical properties of crystal-clear HD streaming quality on Discord.

With a single use, you and everyone in a designated voice channel can enjoy crystal-clear HD streaming quality for the next 12 hours - without anyone needing an active Nitro subscription or Server Boosts.

Example of Using an HD Splash Potion 

NOTE: Potion availability and streaming quality may be impacted by the device conditions of participants in the channel.

Why and when should I use the HD Splash Potion?

The HD Splash Potion is perfect for any moment where you and your friends want to enjoy crystal-clear HD streaming quality together at the same time, even when you don’t have server boosts or an active Nitro subscription.

Whether you’re gaming together, hosting a watch-and-hangout session, or studying with others, some examples of popular situations to sip your HD Splash potion could include:

  • Group gaming sessions
  • Watch parties
  • Group gatherings and hangouts
  • Community events like music, art, and talent shows
  • Study sessions and presentations

How do I activate and use my HD Splash Potion?

You and your friends can enjoy enhanced streaming quality by following these steps:
1. In a voice channel, select the Screen Share [] icon.

Share Your Screen Button in Voice Channel

2. In the Screen Share pop out, locate and select your HD Splash Potion. This channel will become your designated space where your entire squad can enjoy streaming in HD quality together.
Choose a voice channel carefully. The potion’s HD splash effect can’t be moved to a different channel once after it’s activated.

Selecting the HD Splash Potion in Screen Share Menu

3. Once you’re certain of the voice channel, be sure to confirm.

HD Splash Potion Voice Channel Selection and Confirmation: Your first HD Splash Potion is free on us! Afterwards, you can purchase more potions as needed. 

And that’s it! You’ll know you and your squad are enjoying HD streaming quality once you see the HD tag over your streams.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: What platforms is the HD Splash Potion available on?

A: Currently, it’s only available on desktop devices.

Q: How much do HD Splash Potions cost?

A: Your first HD Splash Potion is free so you can try it out to see if you like it. After using your free potion, additional HD Splash Potions can be purchased for $0.99 USD each.

Q: Do I need Nitro or server boosts to use an HD Splash Potion?

A: Nope! The HD Splash Potion grants HD streaming quality in a designated channel for a set period of time—for you, your friends, and other server members who have access to that voice channel. No Nitro or server boosts required!

Q: How long does the HD Splash Potion last?

A: Once used, the HD Splash Potion will grant 12 hours of HD streaming quality in the channel where it was activated. Anyone who joins the designated channel will enjoy HD streaming until the potion’s effect expires.

You can still control your streaming quality at any time. For instance, if you notice your device’s performance struggling, you can adjust the streaming quality in the Share Your Screen pop out.

Q: Does everyone in the channel need to have or use a HD Splash Potion to enjoy HD streaming quality?

A: Nope! Just one person needs to use their potion in a designated channel to grant everyone in that channel the ability to benefit from HD streaming quality.

Q: Do I need to be friends with the potion user to receive HD streaming from the potion?

A: Not at all! Once someone uses their HD Splash potion in a channel, anyone can enjoy HD streaming quality in that designated channel, regardless of friendship status.

Q: What happens when the 12 hours are up?

A: Once the time is up, HD streaming quality in the designated channel will return to its standard quality for anyone without an active Nitro subscription.

Q: Can I move the HD Splash effect from my potion to a different channel after I’ve activated it in one channel?

A: Nope. The HD Splash potion will only grant its effect in the channel where it was used. Choose the voice channel carefully before activating the potion.

Q: What’s your refund policy for the HD Splash Potion?

A: Potions are non-refundable—we’re unable to refund potions after purchase or use.

Q: What happens if a person with low bandwidth is watching my HD Splash Potion stream?

A: The effect of the HD Splash Potion can be impacted by the technical limitations of your or your fellow streamers' device or bandwidth. HD streaming capability may be limited if people watching your stream have low bandwidth or are tuning in from an unsupported device. To ensure that everyone in the call can benefit from the HD Splash Potion, make sure everyone in the call has a strong internet connection and is watching from a desktop device.

articles.name: Halloween Event 2024 FAQ
articles.title: Halloween Event 2024 FAQ
articles.body:
NOTE: This sound pack is available on desktop and browser only. This event was sadly too eerie for iOS and Android at this time. 👻

Another year - another ghostly Halloween! We’ll be exchanging our normal Discord call tone for something eerier. So grab a fiend or friend and give them a call, or have them call you! Lookout for more eerie sound effects throughout as well! 

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: How long will this sound pack be available?

A: The Halloween sound pack will be available from October 24, 2024 - November 3, 2024. 

Q: Where can I enable this sound pack? 

A: The Halloween sound pack should be available automatically at 10:00AM PST. 

If you've disabled the Halloween sound pack, you can re-enable it. Go to User Settings > Notifications. Then select Halloween from the Event Sound Pack dropdown menu.

Halloween Event Sound Pack in Notifications Settings

Q: Will this be available on all devices and clients?

A: The Halloween sound pack will be available on our desktop and browser clients. This event was sadly too eerie for iOS and Android at this time. 👻

Q: Can I disable this ringtone and revert back to the default ringtone?

A: For desktop and browser users, you'll be able to go to User Settings > Notifications. Then select Discord Default from the Event Sound Pack dropdown menu.

How to Revert Event Sound Pack to Discord Default in Notifications Settings

NOTE: If you have the Incoming Ring setting disabled, this will also automatically disable the Halloween sound pack. 

Q: Can I download this sound pack?

A: Sadly, there is no downloadable file for the sound pack and is only available in-client until November 3, 2024.
